intro: Lippia ciliata, commonly known as the hairy lippia, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the verbena family (Verbenaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in open woodlands or along roadsides. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, round fruits called schizocarps. Lippia ciliata is also valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
